conclusion: Understand the geometry of the semicircular glass brick with radius R and critical angle γ.
Analyze the incident angle where light rays strike the flat base at angle π - γ.
At the curved surface, total internal reflection occurs for light at the critical angle γ.
Light striking the curved surface at an angle ≥ γ will undergo total internal reflection.
Consider tangent point T on the curved surface where light grazes the curve; for light to pass through the base, the incidence angle must be < γ.
The tangent ray forms an angle γ with the normal at T.
The width MN is the distance on the flat base where light can pass through without total internal reflection.
Calculate width MN using semicircle geometry; related to radius R and angle γ.
The tangent light ray forms a right-angled triangle with radius R as hypotenuse and sin(γ) as opposite side.
Final answer: The width of the portion of the base through which light passes is 2R sin(γ).
